intro: Lapeirousia neglecta, commonly known as the Orange River daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, tuberous roots that help it survive in dry conditions. Lapeirousia neglecta is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant blooms and hardy nature.
